intro: [WRONG START] Polygonum bisculatum, commonly known as the two-ridged knotweed, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive leaf shapes and often swollen nodes. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with prominent veins and often have a reddish or purple tinge. The small flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom in late summer, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
